page.title: 07Nursing Home North Clifton
page.content: In the spring of 1984 a Private Nursing Home was opened in North Clifton Hall by Mr.and Mrs,Willis.This is a Victorian mansion built by the Freeth family who were benefactors of the village in the latter part of the 19th Century.Before it became a Nursing Home it had been a Children's Home.Extensive alterations had to be made to the building to make it suitable for a nursing home including the installation of a lift and a patients communication system.The Home provides mostly convalescent facilities for private patients after major operations.Mr.and Mrs.Willis are both qualified nurses.The Home has provided work for many women in the area in the form of nursing,domestic help such as cleaning and cooking.There facilities for 17 patients
